channel.title: Connecting To server?
channel.description: I got this weird problem when i try to connect to my server? i changed all the ip's within the client and the source. I'm portforwarded on 43594 but i still dont understand why i cant connect to the server using my no-ip? i only can connect through localhost but thats about it. Im about to use hamachi because i have no other choice or can i do 5555?

item.title: Connecting To server?
item.dc:creator: @RunePKn00b RunePKn00b
item.description:
@RunePKn00b wrote:

I know that if you have some sort of bittorrent client that it wont put the server online until you close it, even if the run.bat says it’s working

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting To server?
item.dc:creator: @hatem hatem
item.description:
@hatem wrote:

ProjectRezurrection:

I got this weird problem when i try to connect to my server? i changed all the ip’s within the client and the source. I’m portforwarded on 43594 but i still dont understand why i cant connect to the server using my no-ip? i only can connect through localhost but thats about it. Im about to use hamachi because i have no other choice or can i do 5555?

Please provide me more information,did you check if the port forwarding is successfully ON?.

Please port forward the port:43594 and rune the server then go to www.canyouseeme.org then type the port 43594 after that you will see if the port forwarding is Okay or Not.
Edit:checking by this site doesn’t check no ip too. only checks the port forwarding.

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting To server?
item.dc:creator: @ProjectRezurrection ProjectRezurrection
item.description:
@ProjectRezurrection wrote:

I think its my internet because one day i was hosting for like 2 weeks and all of a sudden boom i cant host anymore

Read full topic

item.title: Connecting To server?
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Check to see if your client is binding to the same port your server is binding too.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ProjectRezurrection wrote:

Because it says " We can sucessfully see ports opened on 43594" , but idk my firewall if off and like i said ive hosted before. But one day it just stopped working

@RunePKn00b wrote:

I feel like it’s your portforwards, how can you be so sure you did it correctly. Also within the DUC did you check the box for your server on no-ip?

item.title: Connecting To server?
item.dc:creator: @JDETSC JDETSC
item.description:
@JDETSC wrote:

Some companies disable ports or some ports are not usable by any kind. I suggest using 43595 or 5555. If none work then, I suggest switching to a better company.

Read full topic
